page.title: 10LEAVING SANTON DOWNHAM
page.content: Although local buses between Thetford and Brandon, and a Norwich_Cambridge coach, pass through the block along the B1107, there is no stop. The village is served only on Tuesdays by a shoppers' bus and local firms coaches on random routes; people may also use the school bus. The Cambridge _ Norwich railway runs through the area, following the L. Ouse river, and crosses the very minor road by an automatic crossing; the nearest stations are Brandon and Thetford. The nearest airports are Cambridge and Norwich. The river was navigable until the beginning of this century, but awkward stanches without locks had to be negotiated. Remains of old landing stages can still be seen at Santon. Personal transport, or a strong pair of legs, is essential for the local populace.
